intro: Banisteriopsis macedoana, commonly known as the Brazilian snakeroot, is a climbing plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are small, spherical berries that turn red when mature. Banisteriopsis macedoana is valued for its traditional medicinal uses, particularly in the treatment of inflammatory conditions.
